definition: (literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: It's a shocking incident but in some ways understandable.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎駭人聽聞，但從某種意義上說也完全可以理解。

sentences.english: It's absolutely appalling, I'm trembling with anger.
sentences.chinese: 這絕對是駭人聽聞的，我氣得直髮抖。

sentences.english: My mother’s bank manager gave her appalling advice, " said one well-connected woman.
sentences.chinese: 我母親的銀行經理給出的建議駭人聽聞。

sentences.english: This is an outrage, yet no one seems to know or care about it.
sentences.chinese: 這是駭人聽聞的事件，然而似乎沒有人知道或在乎。

sentences.english: The Inquisition of the Medieval Ages devised many demoniac means of torture.
sentences.chinese: 中世紀的宗教法庭創造了許多駭人聽聞的酷刑。

sentences.english: Nothing can extenuate such appalling behavior.
sentences.chinese: 這種駭人聽聞的行徑罪不可恕。

sentences.english: However, the lack of sex education has led to some shocking stories.
sentences.chinese: 然而，性教育的缺失已經導致一些駭人聽聞的故事。

definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
could happen at any moment/on the verge
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
Huwei town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
